text:
I'll never ever do that:
• client won't be able to preview changes
• you're unable to respond to any publish / update changes in the CMS (if you intended to go full static and needed to trigger a redeploy)
• how are you supposed to build a page in the editor if you don't build a HubSpot theme that visually shows you the row / column system?
The list can go on, what I'll do instead (if you don't want to use HubSpot as a cms and want to go headless) is to build the website with any other headless CMS of your choice and just add HS tracking and HS forms

Just following up on this as we just tested some of our non-HubSpot sites with the thought that the pagetest tool itself had issues.

We see no change to our WP / Payload / Umbraco etc. sites, so I doubt it’s an issue with the service
thanks for the detailed response.  i will send this to the team
do you have a specific site that i can send to them as an example?  also, do you happen to have an old speed test to compare to :fingerscrossed:
Yes i’ll pm you a couple
Sent, fingers crossed that they are able to work something out :slightly_smiling_face:
Hey! I also have some recent data screenshots to share. I will DM you with the information <@UD53A9UUR>. Hope it helps!

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Thank you for your reply <@UV23JHEJY>. I was hoping that users could preview/build pages in the HubSpot visual editor as they went then save or publish changes that are picked up by the site. Meaning using the HubSpot CMS to design/create content islands (such as an easily editable section, page, or blog post), however, it seems that isn't an option. We would have wanted to go largely with an SSR approach where content from HubSpot would be cached and refetched after it was stale. While not really relevant to this, some headless CMS solutions allow you to fetch draft or preview pages such as by having a query parameter that's picked up and used to use the draft content, allowing for previews and most headless CMSs allow you to specify a webhook to trigger redeploys if using static.

Thank you for your thoughts. It does seem that just adding tracking and forms will be what we have to do. Thanks again!
